conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the semi-cylindrical transparent object.
The semi-cylindrical object has a radius R.
The light enters at point C, which is at a distance of \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R \) from the center O.
The distance from O to C is \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R \).
The distance from C to the surface is \( R(1 - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}) \).
The angle of incidence \( \theta_i \) can be found using trigonometry.
\( \sin(\theta_i) = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \).
Snell's Law states \( n_1 \sin(\theta_i) = n_2 \sin(\theta_r) \).
At the critical angle, \( \theta_r = 90^\circ \), so \( \sin(\theta_r) = 1 \).
Rearrange Snell's Law: \( n_2 = \frac{\sin(\theta_i)}{\sin(90^\circ)} = \sin(\theta_i) \).
Substitute \( \theta_i \): \( n_2 = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \).
The light is totally internally reflected, meaning the angle of incidence is the critical angle.
The refractive index \( n_2 \) is thus \( \frac{1}{\sin(\theta_i)} \).
The refractive index of the transparent object for this monochromatic light is \( \sqrt{3} \).
